d2e92b5ff3bf1e2c4932dbfeb29a0148 (19:18): I'd suggest a 14.1" laptop as the ideal balance of portabiliity and useability.  i have a dell latitude d600 (year old business model, replaced with the d610), uses the centrino/pentium-M mix.  one thing I -definately- recommend, getting a 7200rpm disk, it makes it WAY faster than 5400 (I know, my 40GB 5400 died, so I replaced it with a 100gb 7200)

443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (19:58): im sure wikipedia would love a couple of t2000 boxes for the database
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (20:19): hali; wouldn't do much good with mysql... maybe if they ported to Oracle.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (20:40): I'm not sure postgres's innards are multithreaded enough to take advantage of the 32-way nature of the t2000
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (20:42): Wikipedia also wouldn't like the lack thereof partitioning capabilities in PostgreSQL.
53303ac79660a60ff15ef2ae2835996f (20:42): which is mainly why they're using MySQL, last time I checked
